title: Travel Grant Recipient, Tethys Summit 2025
description: Awarded a travel grant to attend the Tethys Summit 2025 in recognition of contributions to the Tethys Platform and GEOGLOWS open-source ecosystems.

title: Selected Participant, NCAR Graduate Visitor Program (GVP)
description: Chosen to collaborate with scientists at the National Center for Atmospheric Research on climate-hydrology research as part of a competitive summer research residency.

title: ORISE Fellow, U.S. Department of Defense Research Participation Program
description: Selected for a prestigious fellowship focusing on hydrological modeling and analysis.

title: Winner, AGU Catchment Hydrology Subcommittee Early Career Competition
description: Awarded for submission on rainfall-runoff modeling using LSTM sequence-to-sequence learning models.

title: CyberTraining Workshop Travel Support
description: Awarded a travel grant to attend the CyberTraining workshop.

title: AGU-Chapman Travel Grant
description: Travel support for Chapman Conference on Remote Sensing of the Water Cycle, Honolulu, HI, Feb 13–16, 2024.

title: Full Scholarship with Graduate Research Assistant Position
description: Full scholarship under Prof. Dr. Rocky Talchabhadel from the 'Hydrological Impacts Computing, Outreach, and Resiliency Partnership (HICORPS) Project' in collaboration with ERDC and WOOLPERT.

title: Merit-Based Full Four-Year Scholarship
description: Awarded for securing 19th rank out of approximately 15,000 engineering aspirants for undergraduate study in Civil Engineering.

title: Merit-Based Full Two-Year Scholarship
description: Awarded full scholarship for higher secondary education based on academic excellence.

title: Second Position, Western Regional Inter-Secondary School Mathematics Quiz Contest
description: Secured second place in a regional inter-school mathematics competition.

title: President, Junior Red Cross Society
description: Provided leadership and oversight of the chapter's activities and community service initiatives.

title: Participant, i-Plea – 1st International Environment Olympiad
description: Honored with Certificate of Participation at an international-level environment event.

title: First Position, International Mathematics Competition Nepal
organization: Asia Association of Education and Exchange (AAEE), Tokyo, Japan
description: Won first place in the national-level mathematics competition organized by AAEE.
